model

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • model.Map
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Map
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Map class, creates a new map. Also handles moving units, adding/removing units on the map and checking to see if a space is occupied.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Map

        public Map(double difficulty,
           java.lang.String gameType,
           boolean testingMode)
        Instantiates a new map by reading in a text file that is determined by a variable sent in.
        Parameters:
        difficulty - Takes in a double representing the difficulty. Is used to pick what map to make.
        gameType - the game type
        testingMode - the testing mode

    • Method Detail

      • getBackground

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getBackground()
        Gets the background. If the background is null, which is if a game is loaded from save, then it will create a new background. This way, the background is an image in itself and only have to be printed once instead of each tile being printed.
        Returns:
        the background

      • addEnemies

        Parameters:

        testingMode - the testing mode

      • moveUnit

        public void moveUnit(int startRow,
                     int startCol,
                     int moveToRow,
                     int moveToCol)
        When called it moves the selected unit to the selected spot.
        Parameters:
        startRow - the start row used to pick the unit to move.
        startCol - the start col used to pick the unit to move.
        moveToRow - the move to row used to pick the space to move the unit to.
        moveToCol - the move to col used to pick the space to move the unit to.
